Posted By: Madrai (1/28/2012 11:29:25 PM)

posts.post_content:
@Sobieski I think you're missing a few crucial points. First, I don't know that many decks *require* two Parallels out. In competitive play, no, you won't burn a turn to get a second Parallel. In more casual settings, yes. At that point it's a more realistic comparison of one Parallel w/ one Master's Call, Midnight Haunting, or Lingering Souls against two of those generators, which is only a difference of ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) that nets you a permanent boost for all future token generation. Then you're talking ![10](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=10&type=symbol) for 8 tokens instead of ![9](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=9&type=symbol) for 6 tokens, and both from three cards.  
  
The doubling power also brings extra beef to late game plays for early small token generation. If you draw some of your "weaker" generators later game, the Parallel means they can still have an impact even in a fatty laden battlefield.  
  
And while this may be a T4 drop, with the easy ramp available to ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol), it's quite easy for this to hit T3 instead ( true, Garruck can also hit then. )  
  
Yes, people want to talk abo... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@Sobieski I think you're missing a few crucial points. First, I don't know that many decks require two Parallels out. In competitive play, no, you won't burn a turn to get a second Parallel. In more casual settings, yes. At that point it's a more realistic comparison of one Parallel w/ one Master's Call, Midnight Haunting, or Lingering Souls against two of those generators, which is only a difference of that nets you a permanent boost for all future token generation. Then you're talking for 8 tokens instead of for 6 tokens, and both from three cards.

The doubling power also brings extra beef to late game plays for early small token generation. If you draw some of your "weaker" generators later game, the Parallel means they can still have an impact even in a fatty laden battlefield.

And while this may be a T4 drop, with the easy ramp available to , it's quite easy for this to hit T3 instead ( true, Garruck can also hit then. )

Posted By: RedJaron (6/21/2012 12:26:48 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
3.5/5. Great card but it doesn't make a deck (for me); just improves existing decks.  
  
While not strictly as good as [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season), in my meta they have almost the exact same effect as almost no one I play with uses *Walkers* but this (can) hit the table sooner. The deck I want to run this in would be an Eldrazi deck to get bonus Spawn from [Skittering Invasion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skittering Invasion) and the like.   
  
The main reason this card is strictly better for me personally? I can buy 4 for significantly less then even 1 Doubling Season.
posts.html:

The main reason this card is strictly better for me personally? I can buy 4 for significantly less then even 1 Doubling Season.
